New Records: Shreyas Iyer scored 128 runs off 94 balls, the highest score in the match.
Suryakumar Yadav scored 2 runs off 2 balls, achieving a strike rate of 200, a new personal record.
India recorded the highest score of 410/4 in the match.
Netherlands scored 250/10, their second-lowest score in ODIs.
Key Match Events: Shreyas Iyer's 128-run innings was the second-highest individual score in an ODI by an Indian player.
KL Rahul scored 102 runs off 64 balls, his highest score in ODIs.
Mohammed Shami took 2 wickets for 41 runs, his best bowling figures in ODIs.
Kuldeep Yadav took 2 wickets for 41 runs, his best bowling figures in ODIs.
Ravindra Jadeja took 2 wickets for 49 runs, his best bowling figures in ODIs.
Pre-Game Insights: India elected to bat first after winning the toss.
Post-Match Reflections: The win was a significant morale booster for India ahead of the World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.
The match was a day-night encounter and was played on November 12, 2023.
Others: Umpires: Chris Gaffaney (DRS), Michael Gough (DRS), Joel Wilson (TV Umpire), Chris Brown (Reserve Umpire).
